intro: Askellia pseudonaniformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf askellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
